modules.description: This module provides metadata about SVG documents, including content type, supported versions, standards, and namespaces. It defines constants for SVG-specific declarations such as doctype, empty tags, and alternative content types. Useful for validating or generating SVG output with proper headers and structural constraints.

This module provides functions for constructing and transforming XML trees with dynamic content using a monomorphic tree and list structure. It supports operations like `return` for embedding values, `fmap` for applying functions to tree nodes, and list-like constructors such as `nil`, `singleton`, `cons`, and `append` for building and combining sequences of trees. Concrete use cases include generating HTML documents with reactive or dynamic elements in web applications.

This module provides constants for HTML document metadata, including content type, supported versions, and document structure definitions. It defines values like `doctype`, `namespace`, and `emptytags` used to construct and validate HTML documents. These values are used directly in generating HTML output and ensuring compliance with standards.

This module enables the creation and manipulation of typed SVG elements with dynamic, reactive properties through `Lwd.t` values, supporting complex visual effects, animations, and interactive graphics. It includes data types for SVG-specific constructs such as gradients, filters, and event handlers, allowing precise control over rendering and behavior. The child module handles SVG document metadata, providing constants for namespaces, content types, and version declarations, ensuring correct document structure and validation. Together, they support tasks like building responsive data visualizations, exporting valid SVG files with proper headers, and applying type-safe transformations to vector graphics.

This module enables the construction and manipulation of HTML attributes and elements using reactive `Lwd.t` signals, facilitating dynamic updates to web interfaces. It provides type-safe utilities for handling DOM events, form controls, media elements, and accessibility attributes, operating on typed values such as strings, URIs, numbers, and booleans. A companion module supplies constants like `doctype`, `namespace`, and `emptytags` for defining document structure and ensuring standards compliance. Together, they support building interactive, real-time web applications with safe, composable HTML generation and robust document scaffolding.

This module constructs and manipulates DOM elements using Tyxml, supporting both static and reactive attributes. It works with elements, nodes, and attributes, enabling dynamic content rendering in web applications. Concrete use cases include building interactive UI components with real-time data updates and rendering HTML structures from functional descriptions.

This module enables type-safe construction and manipulation of XML elements with a focus on HTML, supporting dynamic content through typed attributes, primitive conversions, and event handlers. It provides core data types like `elt` for live nodes and attribute containers, along with operations to build and transform structured XML trees. Submodules extend this capability with list-like combinators such as `cons`, `append`, and `fmap`, allowing the creation of dynamic, reactive HTML content. Examples include rendering interactive forms, building HTML documents from data streams, and managing dynamic UI components in web applications.

This module combines XML and HTML document construction with reactive DOM manipulation, using TyXML and Lwd to create dynamic web content. It supports typed elements and attributes, SVG and HTML-specific constructs, and event handling through `Lwd.t` signals for building responsive interfaces and visualizations. Core data types include `elt` for DOM nodes, attribute containers, and typed SVG elements, with operations for dynamic updates, document scaffolding, and real-time rendering. Examples include interactive forms, data-driven visualizations, and reactive UI components updated from streams or user input.
